title: Hawk-Headed Cover of Canopic Jar
description:
Limestone stopper for a canopic jar in the form of a falcon's head (Kebehsenuef).  The falcon wears a heavy wig.  The details of the broad collar, beak, and markings of the eye are picked out in black paint; the pupils of the eyes are painted red.  The plug is long.

Condition: Numerous chips; the underside is crudely carved; dirty.

museum_location.name: This item is not on view
